div1.p: Jacob Watson, a soldier serving with David Demus in the 54th Massachusetts, writes to his brother, Hezekiah Watson, about sending money to an "old man" with David Demus.

figure.p: Letterhead: Picture of a female figure holding a U.S. flag next to the following words--"We must keep Flag where it e'er his stood/ In front of the Free, Wise, and the Good/ And fight and full, at our Country's call,/ And defend the Flag of the People."

div1.p: I take this opportunity of informing you that I am Well as Present & Hope that when this Comes to your Hand it may Find you enjoying the Blessings of God I thought that I would Let you Know that I would Not get Home this time So I thought that you would like to send some money to the old man with David Demus But if I was you I would not send more than twenty Dollars & you can send any thing under this I will Send the old man ten Dollars & Martha twenty With Him you Can send just as much as you Please
